Detailed Description
Represents the Eggholder optimization function.
The Eggholder function is a mathematical function commonly used for testing optimization algorithms. It is characterized by a complex surface with several local minima and a global minimum. The function is typically used within the specified domain and is considered challenging due to its rugged nature and numerous local optima.
